rsgauges.config.title: 紅石測量與開關 設定
tile.rsgauges.flatgauge1.name: Analog Voltmeter Redstone Gauge
tile.rsgauges.flatgauge2.name: Analog Bar Redstone Gauge
tile.rsgauges.flatgauge3.name: Small Digital Display Redstone Gauge
tile.rsgauges.flatgauge4.name: Glass Bar Redstone Gauge
tile.rsgauges.flatgauge5.name: Glass Tube Redstone Gauge
tile.rsgauges.flatgauge6.name: Small Analog Voltmeter Redstone Gauge
tile.rsgauges.gauge_rustic2.name: Rustic Circular Wall Meter Redstone gauge
tile.rsgauges.flatgauge1.help:
§6A display device that can be attached to a solid block to visualise the \
                              redstone power of that block.§r\n\
                              If the block can provide power itself, the \
                              gauge uses the output of it, otherwise the gauge will indirectly measure \
                              the power that the block receives from adjacent blocks. \
                              Strong and weak power is supported. Indirect weak measurements may have \
                              a short latency.
tile.rsgauges.indicator_led_white.name: White LED Redstone Indicator
tile.rsgauges.indicator1.name: Green LED Redstone Indicator
tile.rsgauges.indicator2.name: Yellow LED Redstone Indicator
tile.rsgauges.indicator3.name: Red LED Redstone Indicator
tile.rsgauges.indicator4.name: Alarm Lamp
tile.rsgauges.indicator1blink1.name: Green Blinking LED Redstone Indicator
tile.rsgauges.indicator2blink1.name: Yellow Blinking LED Redstone Indicator
tile.rsgauges.indicator3blink1.name: Red LED Redstone Indicator
tile.rsgauges.soundindicator1.name: Alarm Siren
tile.rsgauges.indicator_rustic_flag.name: Rustic Redstone Semaphore
tile.rsgauges.indicator_led_white.help:
§6A small device that can be attached to a block to indicate \
                              if that block is powered.§r\n\
                              If the block can provide power itself, it uses the output of the block, \
                              otherwise it looks up the power that the block receives from adjacent \
                              blocks.\n\
                              Left click with dye to change the LED color.
${tile.rsgauges.indicator_led_white.help} Blinks with a frequency of about 0.5Hz.
tile.rsgauges.indicator1blink1.help: ${tile.rsgauges.indicator_led_white.help} Blinks with a frequency of about 0.5Hz.
tile.rsgauges.indicator2blink1.help: ${tile.rsgauges.indicator_led_white.help} Blinks with a frequency of about 0.5Hz.
tile.rsgauges.indicator3blink1.help: ${tile.rsgauges.indicator_led_white.help} Blinks with a frequency of about 0.5Hz.
tile.rsgauges.indicator4.help:
§6A red lamp that blinks when detecting a redstone signal from the block \
                              it is attached to.§r Emits light when active.
tile.rsgauges.soundindicator1.help:
§6A siren that frequently emits an alarm sound when detecting a redstone \
                              signal from the block it is attached to.
tile.rsgauges.indicator_rustic_flag.help:
§6A small metal case with a semaphore flag, which raises \
                              when the block to that the indicator is attached to is powered.§r\n\
                              If the block can provide power itself, it uses the output of the block, \
                              otherwise it looks up the power that the block receives from adjacent \
                              blocks.\n\
                              Left click with dye to tint the flag.
rsgauges.switch.feature.pulseextend.help: Activate while already active to extend the pulse time.
rsgauges.switch.feature.pulsetime.help: Left-click with a stack of redstone to set a fixed pulse time between 0.1s (1) and 6.4s (64).
rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.hel: Click with a Redstone Torch to configure the output (cycles through the options that this switch supports).
rsgauges.switch.feature.colortinting.hel: Left-click with any dye to color tint the switch.
rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help: Click with an Ender pearl to get a Switch Link Pearl linked to this switch.
rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help: Click with a Switch Link Pearl to use this switch as link source.
rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offde: Left-click with a stack of redstone to set the hold-time between 0.1s (1) and 6.4s (64).
rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.touch: Click on the touch config up/down buttons to set output power, entity filter, entity count, and sensitivity.

rsgauges.switch.feature.typepulse.help: §6A switch that outputs a redstone signal for a short time, like a button.\n§r
tile.rsgauges.arrowtarget.help:
§6A target that emits a redstone pulse to the block it is attached to when it is hit with an arrow or activated by hand.\n§r\
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat1.name: Industrial Door Contact Mat
tile.rsgauges.contactmat2.name: Industrial Contact Mat
tile.rsgauges.contactmat3.name: Industrial Shock Sensitive Contact Mat
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_rustic1.name: Rustic Door Pressure Plate
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_rustic2.name: Rustic Pressure Plate
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_rustic3.name: Rustic Shock Sensitive Pressure Plate
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_glass1.name: Configurable Glass Contact Plate
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_glass2.name: Glass Contact Plate
tile.rsgauges.contactmat1.help:
§6An industrial floor contact mat that emits a redstone signal when exposed to mechanical pressure \
                               on the top (e.g. someone standing on it), and a short time after the pressure was released.§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.touch.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat2.help:
§6An industrial floor contact mat that emits a redstone signal when exposed to mechanical pressure on \
                               the top side (e.g. someone standing on it), and a short time after the pressure was released.§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat3.help:
§6An industrial contact mat emitting a redstone pulse when exposed to mechanical shock from above \
                               (e.g. something falls on it).§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. Power is always 15. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_rustic1.help:
§6A metal plate that emits a redstone signal when exposed to mechanical pressure from above \
                               (e.g. someone standing on it), and a short time after the pressure was released.§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.touch.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_rustic2.help:
§6A metal plate that emits a redstone signal when exposed to mechanical pressure from above \
                               (e.g. someone standing on it), and a short time after the pressure was released.§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_rustic3.help:
§6A metal plate emitting a redstone pulse when exposed to mechanical shock from above \
                               (e.g. something falls on it).§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. Power is always 15. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_glass1.help:
§6A glass floor plate that changes color and emits a redstone signal when exposed to mechanical pressure on the top \
                               (e.g. someone standing on it), and a short time after the pressure was released.§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. Does not emit any sounds. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.touch.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.colortinting.help}
tile.rsgauges.contactmat_glass2.help:
§6A glass floor plate that changes color and emits a redstone signal when exposed to mechanical pressure on the top \
                               (e.g. someone standing on it), and a short time after the pressure was released.§r\n\
                               Outputs are to the front and bottom. Does not emit any sounds. Sensors are high sensitive. \
                               ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.colortinting.help}
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch1.name: Industrial Shock Activated Trapdoor
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch2.name: Industrial Sensitive Shock Activated Trapdoor
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch3.name: Industrial Fall-Through Detection Frame
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch1.help:
§6An industrial floor trap door that swings open and emits a redstone signal when \
                                   someone or something falls on it.§r\n\
                                   Output is to the block it is mounted on. \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch2.help:
§6An industrial floor trap door that swings open and emits a redstone signal when \
                                   someone or something falls on it, or when someone walks on it without sneaking.§r\n\
                                   Output is to the block it is mounted on. \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch3.help:
§6An industrial sensor frame that emits a redstone signal when something falls through it.§r\n\
                                   Output is to the block it is mounted on. \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch_rustic1.hel:
§6A metal floor trap door that swings open and emits a redstone signal when \
                                   someone or something falls on it.§r\n\
                                   Output is to the block it is mounted on. \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch_rustic2.hel:
§6Metal floor trap door that swings open and emits a redstone signal when \
                                   someone or something falls on it, or when someone walks on it without sneaking.§r\n\
                                   Output is to the block it is mounted on. \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.trapdoorswitch_rustic3.hel:
§6A metal trap door that swings open emits a redstone signal when something touches it.§r\n\
                                   Output is to the block it is mounted on. \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                   ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch1.name: Industrial Infrared Entity Detector
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch2.name: Industrial Linear Laser Entity Detector
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch3.name: Industrial Local Light Sensor
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch4.name: Industrial Day Timer Clock
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch5.name: Industrial Rain Sensor
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch6.name: Industrial Thunderstorm Detector
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch7.name: Industrial Interval Signal Timer
tile.rsgauges.detectorswitch_glass1.name: Glass Infrared Entity Detector
tile.rsgauges.detectorswitch_glass2.name: Glass Linear Laser Entity Detector
tile.rsgauges.daytimeswitch_glass1.name: Glass Day Timer Clock
tile.rsgauges.timerswitch_glass1.name: Glass Interval Signal Timer
tile.rsgauges.door_sensor_switch.name: Door sensor
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch1.help:
§6A small device that observes a defined volume and emits a redstone signal if it sees an entity.§r\n\
                                    The volume is two blocks above and below, and 'range' in front, left and right (covers 180 degrees). \
                                    The range can be configured with small buttons on the front face, together with the output strength, \
                                    the number of entities seen, and the entity type seen (mobs, players, animals, etc). \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch2.help:
§6A small device that observes in one direction and emits a redstone signal if it senses an entity.§r\n\
                                    The observed volume is 'range' blocks in front, and half a block to the sides. \
                                    The range can be configured with small buttons on the front face, together with the output strength, \
                                    the number of entities seen, and the entity type seen (mobs, players, animals, etc). \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch3.help:
§6A small device that measures the local light level at its location and emits a redstone signal \
                                    depending on on-threshold and off-threshold set with small buttons on the front face.§r\n\
                                    These buttons also allow to set output power and debouncing. Debouncing delays switching off or on \
                                    until the light level is stable, higher values means better noise filtering, but also more switching \
                                    delay. If on and off settings are identical, then the measured light level must exactly match the set \
                                    value. Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch4.help:
§6A small device that emits a redstone signal from a configured start (day) time to a configured \
                                    end time.§r\n\
                                    The time span is set with buttons on the device front face (24 hour format, where 06:00 is sunrise). \
                                    These buttons also allow to set output power and a randomising value. Latter means delaying \
                                    to switch on or off for a random time span, where higher values cause longer delays. \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch5.help:
§6A small wall mounted device that emits a redstone signal when it rains on it.§r\n\
                                    The buttons on the front facing allow to configure the output signal strength. \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch6.help:
§6A small wall mounted device that emits a redstone signal when it senses a high electric \
                                    potential in the air, i.e. in thunder storms.§r\n\
                                    The buttons on the front facing allow to configure the output signal strength. \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.automaticswitch7.help:
§6A small device that emits a rectangular redstone signal with a defined on- and off- time.§r\n\
                                    Timing is configured using buttons on the front facing, and can be set between 0.1s (2 ticks) \
                                    and 600s (10min). The step size adapts to the current values (small steps for small values, \
                                    big steps for big values). The config buttons also enable you to define the output signal \
                                    strength and a ramp value, which will make the timer ramping up and down the redstone signal \
                                    when switching. §eThe timer is placed in standby mode for setup. Click on the front face to \
                                    set it into run mode.§r \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} \
                                    As Switch Link target the timer toggles between run and standby mode.
tile.rsgauges.detectorswitch_glass1.help:
§6A small glass device that observes a defined volume and emits a redstone signal if it sees an entity.§r\n\
                                    The volume is two blocks above and below, and 'range' in front, left and right (covers 180 degrees). \
                                    The range can be configured with small buttons on the front face, together with the output strength, \
                                    the number of entities seen, and the entity type seen (mobs, players, animals, etc). \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. Does not emit switching sounds. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.detectorswitch_glass2.help:
§6A small glass device that observes in one direction and emits a redstone signal if it senses an entity.§r\n\
                                    The observed volume is 'range' blocks in front, and half a block to the sides. \
                                    The range can be configured with small buttons on the front face, together with the output strength, \
                                    the number of entities seen, and the entity type seen (mobs, players, animals, etc). \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. Does not emit switching sounds. \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.daytimeswitch_glass1.help:
§6A small glass device that emits a redstone signal from a configured start (day) time to a configured \
                                    end time.§r\n\
                                    The time span is set with buttons on the device front face (24 hour format, where 06:00 is sunrise). \
                                    These buttons also allow to set output power and a randomising value. Latter means delaying \
                                    to switch on or off for a random time span, where higher values cause longer delays. \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. Does not emit switching sounds.\
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.timerswitch_glass1.help:
§6A small device that emits a rectangular redstone signal with a defined on- and off- time.§r\n\
                                    Timing is configured using buttons on the front facing, and can be set between 0.1s (2 ticks) \
                                    and 600s (10min). The step size adapts to the current values (small steps for small values, \
                                    big steps for big values). The config buttons also enable you to define the output signal \
                                    strength and a ramp value, which will make the timer ramping up and down the redstone signal \
                                    when switching. §eThe timer is placed in standby mode for setup. Click on the front face to \
                                    set it into run mode.§r \
                                    Output is to the block where the sensor is placed on. Does not emit switching sounds.\
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} \
                                    As Switch Link target the timer toggles between run and standby mode.
tile.rsgauges.industrial_comparator_swit:
§6A small device that that emits a redstone signal depending on the comparator output \
                                    level or inventory statistics of the block it is attached to.§r\n\
                                    The buttons on the front facing allow to configure the output signal strength, switch-on comparator \
                                    value, switch-off comparator value, and operating mode ("comparator, free slots, used slots, ..."). \
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.door_sensor_switch.help: §6A player detector that is mounted on walls above doors.§r
tile.rsgauges.observerswitch1.name: Industrial Block Category Detector
tile.rsgauges.observerswitch1.help:
§6A switch emitting a redstone signal if one or more blocks in front if it match \
                                    a configured type or category.§r\n\
                                    The configuration is set using buttons at the opposite side of the detector and \
                                    encompass the 'range' (observing how far), the 'threshold' \
                                    (how many blocks have to match), the 'filter' (criteria, e.g. \
                                    solid, fluid, wood log, ores, plants, crops, mature crops, and other ore dictionary \
                                    based filters), the 'debouncing' (anti-jitter delay), and the output 'power' (at all sides \
                                    except the detector side). Note: The detector recognises modded blocks only \
                                    if they are correctly registered in the ore dictionary (you need to test it). \
                                    §r\n\
                                    ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.dimmerswitch1.name: Industrial Dimmer
tile.rsgauges.dimmerswitch1.help:
§6An industrial manual redstone power dimmer.§r\n\
                                Allows to manually set an output signal between 0 and 15 at the back side \
                                of the device. The vertical click position defines the signal strength. \
                                ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.relay_pulseswitchrx1.name: Industrial Pulse Switch Link Receiver
tile.rsgauges.relay_pulseswitchrx2.name: Industrial Cased Pulse Switch Link Receiver
tile.rsgauges.relay_pulseswitchtx1.name: Industrial Switch Link Pulse Sender
tile.rsgauges.relay_bistableswitchrx1.he:
§6A small industrial bistable switching device that is optimised to be \
                                           used as a Switch Link target.§r\n\
                                           The relay inside is muffled and therefore very silent. \
                                           Can also be manually activated like a lever. \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.relay_bistableswitchrx2.he:
§6A full block cased industrial bistable switching device that is optimised to be \
                                           used as a Switch Link target.§r\n\
                                           The relay inside is muffled and therefore very silent. \
                                           Can also be manually activated like a lever. \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.relay_pulseswitchrx1.help:
§6A small industrial pulse switching device that is optimised to be used as a Switch Link \
                                           target.§r\n\
                                           Like a normal pulse switch it activates for a short time when manually clicked or triggered \
                                           by a switch link. \
                                           The relay inside is muffled and therefore very silent. \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.pulsetime.help}
tile.rsgauges.relay_pulseswitchrx2.help:
§6A full block industrial pulse switching device that is optimised to be used as a Switch Link \
                                           target.§r\n\
                                           Like a normal pulse switch it activates for a short time when manually clicked or triggered \
                                           by a switch link. \
                                           The relay inside is muffled and therefore very silent. \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.pulsetime.help}
tile.rsgauges.relay_bistableswitchtx1.he:
§6A small industrial switching device that is optimised to be \
                                           used as a Switch Link relay with redstone input.§r\n\
                                           The relay cannot emit redstone signals, instead it allows Link Pearls inside to trigger \
                                           when the redstone power of the block it is mounted on changes. \
                                           By double-left clicking empty handed you can change the input polarity (inverted means \
                                           active-low) and strength sensitivity (default weak, strong means that strong power is \
                                           needed to trigger the links). \
                                           Muffled, therefore very silent. Can also be manually activated like a lever for testing. \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.relay_pulseswitchtx1.help:
§6A small industrial pulse switching device that is optimised to be used as a Switch Link relay \
                                           with redstone input.§r\n\
                                           The pulse relay cannot emit redstone signals, instead it allows Link Pearls inside to trigger \
                                           when the redstone power of the block it is mounted on changes. \
                                           It activates for a short time when the redstone input changes from 0 to any higher value. \
                                           By double-left clicking empty handed you can change the input polarity (inverted means \
                                           active-low) and strength sensitivity (default weak, strong means that strong power is needed \
                                           to trigger the links). \
                                           Muffled, therefore very silent. Can also be manually activated like a pulse switch for testing. \
                                           ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.powerplant_yellow.name: Yellow power plant
tile.rsgauges.powerplant_red.name: Red power plant
tile.rsgauges.powerplant_yellow.help:
§6Artificial yellow flower that looks very similar to dandelion, \
                                     emitting a redstone signal to the front and bottom when something \
                                     touches it (like a contact plate).§r\n\
                                     ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                     ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.powerplant_red.help:
§6Artificial yellow flower that looks very similar to a poppy, \
                                     emitting a redstone signal to the front and bottom when something \
                                     touches it (like a contact plate).§r\n\
                                     ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.contactmat.offdelay.help} \
                                     ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.industrial_knock_button.he: §6Emits a redstone pulse when the adjacent block of its facing is clicked.§r ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.pulseextend.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.pulsetime.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}
tile.rsgauges.industrial_knock_switch.he: §6Switches on/off when the adjacent block of its facing is clicked.§r ${rsgauges.switch.feature.outputconfig.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linktarget.help} ${rsgauges.switch.feature.linksource.help}

tile.rsgauges.sensitiveglass.help: §6Glass block that emits light when it is powered by a redstone signal, similar to a redstone lamp.
tile.rsgauges.sensitiveglass_inverted.he:
§6Glass block that normally emits light like a redstone lamp, and switches off \
                                           when it is powered by a redstone signal.§r
rsgauges.sensitiveglass.colored.help:
§6Glass block that changes from transparent to colored when it is powered by a redstone \
                                     signal.§r A faint dashed framing indicates the color in unpowered state.
tile.rsgauges.qube.name: The qube
tile.rsgauges.qube.help: It's a developer block that is not supposed to be craftable or used in the game.
item.rsgauges.switchlink_pearl.name: Switch Link Pearl
item.rsgauges.switchlink_pearl.help:
§6Created by left clicking a switch with an Ender pearl. Remote activates that \
                                    (target) switch when used or plugged into another (source) switch, also by \
                                    left clicking.§r\n\
                                    Change link options by left clicking the target with the Switch Link Pearl (cycles \
                                    through link options). You can plug more than one pearl into a switch. \
                                    Pearls will complain when they are overstressed or cannot find their target, you can hear that. \
                                    If a switch is not suitable to be a source or target for linking, the pearl will also complain. \
                                    Different switch types may differ in their reaction to link triggers (simply experiment a bit).
